intro: Rosa deserta, commonly known as the desert rose, is a shrub native to the arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its thorny stems and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant has small, leathery leaves that help it conserve water in its harsh environment. It produces red, fleshy fruits that contain seeds, which are dispersed by animals. Rosa deserta is well adapted to survive in low-water conditions, making it a hardy species in desert ecosystems.
